messageBody:
On Friday 18 February 2005 09:38, Vamsee Kanakala wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> >Ignore everything except the stored procedures. To test those, you
> > can use something like DbUnit and call the stored procedures from
> > JDBC.
>
> I've tried DBUnit, but I found that it's valuable only when I have
> huge datasets to be compared, inserted etc. Most of the time, I use
> easyMock for mocking the database access layer, and test it
> separately with plain database set/get methods.

I'm using (easy)mocks most of the time, too. Now I'm in a situation
where I want to ensure that multiple DB operations (selects, create
temp tables, inserts, ...) happen in the same transaction, as only then
the code works properly. Are you using mocks in cases like this? How?

Michael
